definitions.body: :Ex 26:1 byssus (loan-wd. prob. fr. Eg. šen-suten Reinischap.DHM:VOJ viii (1894), 7 Copt. šens, cf. Copt. šent, weave; v. M‘Lean:Ency.Bib. LINEN; on spinning, weaving, and wearing of linen in Egypt Erman:Aegypten 594 ff.; Eng. Trans. 448 f.);—always abs. ´[[שׁ]]: ([[שׁשׁי]] Ez Eze 16:13 is error):—byssus, fine Egyptian linen ([[בּוּץ]], q. v., is later synon.), i.e. the linen thread (spun by women Ex 35:25), and the material woven from it: used for garments Ge 41:42 (E), Ez Eze 16:10, Eze 16:13 ([[שׁשׁי]], read [[שׁשׁ]]), Pr 31:22; for sail (in fig. of Tyre as ship) Ez Eze 27:7 (brought from Egypt); elsewhere P, of priestly vestments Ex 28:5, Ex 28:39, Ex 28:39, Ex 39:3, Ex 39:27, Ex 39:28, Ex 39:28; also [[מָשְׁזׇר]] ´[[שׁ]]: twisted linen Ex 28:6, Ex 28:8, Ex 28:15, Ex 39:2, Ex 39:5, Ex 39:8, Ex 39:28, Ex 39:29 + v:Ex 39:24 (read ´[[וְשֵׁשׁ מ]]: Sam LXX Bae); ´[[שׁ]]: of hangings, etc., in tabern. Ex 25:4, Ex 35:6, Ex 35:23, Ex 35:25, Ex 35:35, Ex 38:23, and so [[מָשְׁזׇר]] ´[[שׁ]]: Ex 26:1, Ex 26:31, Ex 26:36, Ex 27:9, Ex 27:16, Ex 27:18, Ex 36:8, Ex 36:35, Ex 36:37, Ex 38:9, Ex 38:16, Ex 38:18.
